item.title: Erinne add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I would rather sit on a pumpkin, and have it all to myself, than be crowded on a velvet cushion." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Mary Shelly
item.description: "Invention, it must be humbly admitted, does not consist in creating out of void but out of chaos." -- Mary Shelly

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Creativity is knowing how to hide your sources" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not. " -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "There are painters who transform the sun to a yellow spot, but there are others who with the help of their art and their intelligence, transform a yellow spot into sun" -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupery
item.description: "A rock pile ceases to be a rock pile the moment a single man contemplates it, bearing within him the image of a cathedral." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupery

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "Mr. Freeman sighs. "No imagination. What are you thirteen? Fourteen? You've already let them beat your creativity out of you!" -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Erinne add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Imagination is the beginning of creation. You imagine what you desire, you will what you imagine and at last you create what you will." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Robert Henri
item.description: "The object isn't to make art, it's to be in that wonderful state which makes art inevitable." -- Robert Henri

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "If you treat an individual as he is, he will remain how he is. But if you treat him as if he were what he ought to be and could be, he will become what he ought to be and could be." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Max Lucado
item.description: "You are the only you God made... God made you and broke the mold." -- Max Lucado

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Everything you can imagine is real." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Erinne add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "A painter should begin every canvas with a wash of black, because all things in nature are dark except where exposed by the light." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "You must have chaos within you to give birth to a dancing star." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "If you want to really hurt you parents, and you don't have the nerve to be gay, the least you can do is go into the arts. I'm not kidding. The arts are not a way to make a living. They are a very human way of making life more bearable. Practicing an art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow, for heaven's sake. Sing in the shower. Dance to the radio. Tell stories. Write a poem to a friend, even a lousy poem. Do it as well as you possible can. You will get an enormous reward. You will have created something." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Bob Ross
item.description: "We don't make mistakes, just happy little accidents." -- Bob Ross

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone" -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "If we, citizens, do not support our artists, then we sacrifice our imagination on the altar of crude reality and we end up believing in nothing and having worthless dreams." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "When I was a child my mother said to me, 'If you become a soldier, you'll be a general. If you become a monk, you'll be the pope.' Instead I became a painter and wound up as Picasso." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Every portrait that is painted with feeling is a portrait of the artist, not of the sitter." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance." -- Aristotle

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Michelangelo Buonarroti
item.description: "If people knew how hard I had to work to gain my mastery, it would not seem so wonderful at all." -- Michelangelo Buonarroti

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Salvador Dalí
item.description: "Each morning when I awake, I experience again a supreme pleasure: that of being Salvador Dali." -- Salvador Dalí

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "There is no abstract art. You must always start with something. Afterward you can remove all traces of reality." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Erinne add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "Whatever the imagination seizes as Beauty must be truth -whether it existed before or not" -- John Keats

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "God is really only another artist. He invented the giraffe, the elephant and the cat. He has no real style, He just goes on trying other things." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Erinne add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "Some people are born to make great art and others are born to appreciate it. … It is a kind of talent in itself, to be an audience, whether you are the spectator in the gallery or you are listening to the voice of the world's greatest soprano. Not everyone can be the artist. There have to be those who witness the art, who love and appreciate what they have been privileged to see." -- Ann Patchett
